IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Develops, operates, and advises private, non-sectarian "Delphi Academy" schools owned and operated by Delphi Schools, Inc., and licenses its "Delphi Program" to schools owned and/or operated by other nonprofit tax-exempt organizations.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Develops, operates, and advises private, non-sectarian "Delphi Academy" schools owned and operated by Delphi Schools, Inc., and licenses its "Delphi Program" to schools owned and/or operated by other nonprofit tax-exempt organizations.
IRS990.Desc: Delphi Schools Inc develops, operates, and advises private, non-sectarian Delphi Academy schools owned and operated by Delphi Schools, Inc., and licenses the Delphi Program to schools owned and/or operated by other nonprofit tax-exempt organizations, in conjunction with Delphi Schools, Inc.s Delphi Program comprised of its: (i) educational curriculum, syllabi, and supporting implementation advice for the education of students in preschool/kindergarten through high school and beyond; (ii) educational publications; and (iii) Delphi trademarks and service marks. Delphi Schools, Inc., currently owns and operates two such schools: a boarding school located in Sheridan, Oregon (The Delphian School); and a day school located in Los Angeles, California (Delphi Academy of Los Angeles). Delphi Schools Inc. owned and operated a day school located in Santa Monica, California (Delphi Academy of Santa Monica) through June 2016 when the school was closed, and Delphi Academy of Campbell through May 9, 2016 when it was spun-off into its own nonprofit organization. Delphi Schools, Inc. also licenses three schools owned and/or operated by other nonprofit tax-exempt organizations: a day school located in Milton, Massachusetts (Delphi Academy of Boston); a day school located in Clearwater, Florida (Delphi Academy of Florida); and a day school located in Campbell, California (Delphi Academy of Campbell).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ENDOWMENT FUNDS WERE SET ASIDE FOR SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS IN SUPPORT OF DELPHI SCHOOLS, INC. STUDENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 3 - Racially Nondiscriminatory Policy Publicized
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS PUBLISHED NOTICE STATING ITS RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY IN THE REQUIRED FORM, IN NEWSPAPERS OF GENERAL CIRCULATION, AND AT LEAST ONCE ANNUALLY (BUT IN ALL EVENTS, DURING ITS REGISTRATION PERIODS).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 4 - Explanation of Records and Materials Not Maintained
Schedule E, Line 5 - Explanation of Organization Discrimination by Race
Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Fellowships, Scholarships, and Financial Aid programs are initially analyzed by the nationally-accredited company FAST (Financial Aid for School Tuition); but are ultimately only awarded based on merit and/or need. All programs are administered pursuant to directives approved by the Board of Directors and are reviewed regularly by administrative staff and the Board of Directors. Funds awarded are accounted for as a reduction in tuition otherwise required under signed enrollment contracts.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part I, Line 1a: Relevant information in regards to selections on 1a.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A majority of Delphi Schools, Inc.'s employees at the Oregon boarding school are required to accept room and board on its premises as a condition of their employment. Section 199 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 excludes the value of such room and board from the taxable gross income of the employees. The value thereof is reported as the employees' non-taxable benefits on Form 990. Neither a written policy nor substantiation is required, since no cash allowances related thereto are provided to the employees.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part I, Line 1b: Reason for not following policy regarding payment provisions for expenses
Schedule L, Part V Supplemental Information
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Julie Nosko Business ManagerApril Denny Ott RegistrarNowell Didear DevelopmentJoelle Rothe TeacherMelissa McPhail Director of MarketingKelly Olivares Medical LiaisonAdam Whitworth TeacherAlyssa Whitworth TeacherThe transaction amount in column (c) consists of cash compensation and the fair market value of non-taxable benefits which may include tuition remission, housing, Section 125 contributions,and employer paid health insurance.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 2: Description of Business or Family Relationship of Officers, Directors, Et
Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 is reviewed by the corporation's management and board of directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DELPHI SCHOOLS, INC., HAS A CONFLICTS-OF-INTEREST POLICY AND A WHISTLE BLOWER POLICY, WHICH TOGETHER ENSURE THAT ANY MEMBER OF THE CORPORATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS (OR ANY COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS), AND/OR ANY OFFICER, EMPLOYEE, FIDUCIARY, OR AGENT OF THE CORPORATION (COLLECTIVELY "INTERESTED PERSON"), WHO HAS A DIRECT OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL INTEREST (A DEFINED TERM, WHICH INCLUDES ALL CIRCUMSTANCES IN WHICH AN INTERESTED PERSON MAY PROFIT FROM AN ACTION OR DECISION BY THE CORPORATION IN WHICH THE INTERESTED PERSONNEL PARTICIPATES, AND OF WHICH HE OR SHE HAS KNOWLEDGE) IN A TRANSACTION OR ACTIVITY, DISCLOSES THE EXISTENCE OF THE FINANCIAL INTEREST. SUCH DISCLOSURE MUST BE MADE TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS (OR IT'S APPROPRIATE COMMITTEE) WHICH, IN TURN, MUST MAKE A DECISION ON WHETHER A CONFLICT EXISTS, AND IF IT DOES, WHETHER THE SUBJECT TRANSACTION OR ACTIVITY IS IN THE CORPORATION'S BEST INTEREST, IS FOR THE CORPORATION'S BENEFIT, AND IS FAIR AND REASONABLE. VIOLATIONS RESULT IN APPROPRIATE DISCIPLINARY AND CORRECTIVE ACTION. ALL OFFICERS, BOARD MEMBERS, AND KEY PERSONNEL SIGN ANNUAL STATEMENTS ATTESTING TO THEIR COMPLIANCE WITH THE CORPORATION'S CONFLICTS-OF-INTEREST POLICY. ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, AND ALL OFFICERS, EMPLOYEES, FIDUCIARIES, AND AGENTS OF THE CORPORATION, ARE ALSO PROVIDED WITH A COPY OF THE CORPORATION'S CONFLICTS-OF-INTEREST POLICY AND WHISTLE BLOWER POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DELPHI SCHOOLS, INC., HAS A COMPENSATION POLICY THAT ENSURES AGAINST PAYMENTS IN EXCESS OF REASONABLE COMPENSATION TO ITS OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, AND KEY EMPLOYEES -- THAT IS, AGAINST PAYMENTS IN EXCESS OF COMPENSATION AMOUNTS THAT WOULD ORDINARILY BE PAID FOR LIKE SERVICES BY A LIKE ORGANIZATION UNDER LIKE CIRCUMSTANCES. IN ADDITION, THE CORPORATION'S CONFLICTS-OF-INTEREST POLICY REQUIRES PERIODIC REVIEW BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO ENSURE THAT COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENTS AND BENEFITS FOR THE CORPORATION'S OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, AND KEY EMPLOYEES DO NOT EXCEED LEVELS THAT ARE REASONABLE, BASED ON INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION CONSULTANT'S WRITTEN ANALYSIS, INDEPENDENT LEGAL COUNSEL REVIEW, AND ARM'S-LENGTH BARGAINING.THE COMPENSATION REVIEW PROCESS DESCRIBED ABOVE WAS COMPLETED IN 2014 FOR GREGORY OTT, ROSEMARY DIDEAR, JOHN NOSKO, AND ALAN ROTHE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Delphi Schools, Inc., makes its governing documents, conflicts-of-interest policy, and/or financial statements available to the public only as required by Federal and State law.
